intro: Bupleurum multinerve var. angustinus, commonly known as narrow-veined bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lanceolate with prominent, parallel veins, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers. The roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
